bodywork.name: Steel
bodywork.description: Steel is a strong and durable metal commonly used in automotive bodywork. While heavier than some alternatives, it offers excellent structural integrity and is cost-effective.

bodywork.name: Aluminum
bodywork.description: Aluminum is a lightweight metal favored for its good strength-to-weight ratio. It reduces the overall weight of the car, enhancing speed and fuel efficiency, though it is less durable than steel.

bodywork.name: Carbon Fiber
bodywork.description: Carbon Fiber is a high-strength composite material known for its exceptional stiffness and low weight. It significantly improves performance and handling but comes at a higher cost.

bodywork.name: Titanium Alloy (Ti-6Al-4V)
bodywork.description: Titanium Alloy (Ti-6Al-4V) offers a superior strength-to-weight ratio and excellent corrosion resistance. It enhances the car's performance while maintaining durability, albeit at a premium cost.

bodywork.name: Graphene Composite
bodywork.description: Graphene Composite utilizes graphene's remarkable strength and conductivity, providing unparalleled durability and performance. It's one of the lightest and most efficient materials available, making it ideal for top-tier F1 cars.

bodywork.name: Magnesium Alloy (AZ31B)
bodywork.description: Magnesium Alloy (AZ31B) is renowned for its lightweight properties, contributing to reduced overall car weight. It offers a balanced mix of durability and elasticity, enhancing performance without significantly increasing costs.

bodywork.name: Kevlar Reinforced Polymer
bodywork.description: Kevlar Reinforced Polymer combines the high tensile strength of Kevlar with polymer matrices, providing excellent impact resistance and flexibility. It's ideal for bodywork components that require both strength and lightweight properties.

bodywork.name: Inconel 718
bodywork.description: Inconel 718 is a nickel-chromium superalloy known for its outstanding mechanical properties and corrosion resistance. It is used in high-stress areas of the bodywork, providing superior durability and performance.

bodywork.name: Silicon Carbide (SiC)
bodywork.description: Silicon Carbide is a hard ceramic material with excellent thermal conductivity and strength. It is used in bodywork for components requiring high-temperature resistance and minimal weight.

bodywork.name: Titanium Diboride (TiB2)
bodywork.description: Titanium Diboride is an ultra-hard ceramic material used in high-performance bodywork components. It offers exceptional wear resistance and thermal stability, ideal for extreme racing conditions.

bodywork.name: Carbon Fiber-Reinforced Boron Nitride
bodywork.description: Carbon Fiber-Reinforced Boron Nitride combines the strength of carbon fiber with boron nitride's thermal properties, providing superior durability and performance for cutting-edge bodywork applications.

bodywork.name: Dual-Phase Steel
bodywork.description: Dual-Phase Steel offers a combination of strength and ductility by having a microstructure of ferrite and martensite. It's used in bodywork for enhanced crash resistance and lightweight design.

bodywork.name: Martensitic Steel
bodywork.description: Martensitic Steel is characterized by its hard and brittle structure, achieved through rapid cooling. It's used in bodywork components requiring high wear resistance and strength.

bodywork.name: High-Strength Low-Alloy Steel (HSLA-100)
bodywork.description: High-Strength Low-Alloy Steel (HSLA-100) provides superior strength with reduced weight. It's ideal for bodywork components that require high durability and performance while minimizing mass.

bodywork.name: Nickel-Chrome Steel
bodywork.description: Nickel-Chrome Steel combines high nickel and chromium content to enhance strength and corrosion resistance. It's used in bodywork for components that require both durability and aesthetic finishes.

bodywork.name: Titanium Aluminum Vanadium (Ti-Al-V) Alloy
bodywork.description: Titanium Aluminum Vanadium Alloy offers a balance of strength, lightweight, and corrosion resistance. It's ideal for high-performance bodywork components that demand superior mechanical properties.

bodywork.name: Aluminum-Lithium Alloy
bodywork.description: Aluminum-Lithium Alloy reduces weight while maintaining strength and stiffness. It's used in bodywork for lightweight structures that require high performance and efficiency.

bodywork.name: Boron Steel
bodywork.description: Boron Steel incorporates boron to improve hardenability and strength. It's used in bodywork for components that need enhanced toughness and resistance to wear.

bodywork.name: Precipitation-Hardening Stainless Steel (17-4 PH)
bodywork.description: Precipitation-Hardening Stainless Steel (17-4 PH) offers high strength and hardness through precipitation hardening. It's used in bodywork for components requiring excellent mechanical properties and corrosion resistance.

aero_elements.name: Aluminum Alloy (7075-T6)
aero_elements.description: Aluminum Alloy (7075-T6) is a high-strength alloy used in aerodynamic components. It offers a good balance between weight and durability, enhancing airflow management around the car.

aero_elements.name: Magnesium Alloy (AZ91D)
aero_elements.description: Magnesium Alloy (AZ91D) is utilized in aero elements for its lightweight characteristics. It helps in reducing the overall aerodynamic drag, contributing to higher speeds.

aero_elements.name: Carbon Fiber Reinforced Plastic (CFRP)
aero_elements.description: Carbon Fiber Reinforced Plastic (CFRP) is widely used in aerodynamic structures for its high strength and low weight. It improves the car's aerodynamic efficiency and overall performance.

aero_elements.name: Titanium Boron Carbide
aero_elements.description: Titanium Boron Carbide is an advanced composite material offering exceptional hardness and thermal stability. It's used in aero components that require resistance to high temperatures and mechanical stress.

aero_elements.name: Carbon Nanotube Reinforced Composite
aero_elements.description: Carbon Nanotube Reinforced Composite integrates carbon nanotubes into composite matrices, significantly enhancing strength and flexibility. It's ideal for high-performance aero elements requiring maximum efficiency.

aero_elements.name: Stainless Steel (17-4 PH)
aero_elements.description: Stainless Steel (17-4 PH) is utilized in aero elements for its excellent corrosion resistance and strength. It ensures the longevity and reliability of aerodynamic components under various racing conditions.

aero_elements.name: Ceramic Matrix Composite (CMC)
aero_elements.description: Ceramic Matrix Composite (CMC) combines ceramic fibers with a ceramic matrix, offering superior thermal resistance and mechanical properties. It's used in high-performance aero components for enhanced durability and performance.

aero_elements.name: Boron Nitride Nanotubes (BNNT)
aero_elements.description: Boron Nitride Nanotubes (BNNT) provide exceptional strength and thermal conductivity. They are integrated into aero composites to enhance durability and performance under extreme conditions.

aero_elements.name: Ultra-High Temperature Ceramic (UHTC)
aero_elements.description: Ultra-High Temperature Ceramics (UHTC) are used in engine components exposed to extreme temperatures. They offer unparalleled thermal resistance and maintain structural integrity under high stress.

aero_elements.name: Graphene-Enhanced Aerodynamic Panels
aero_elements.description: Graphene-Enhanced Aerodynamic Panels incorporate graphene layers to significantly boost strength and reduce weight, ensuring optimal aerodynamic performance and durability.

aero_elements.name: Hexagonal Boron Nitride (h-BN)
aero_elements.description: Hexagonal Boron Nitride (h-BN) is used in aero elements for its thermal stability and lubricating properties. It enhances component longevity and performance under high-stress conditions.

aero_elements.name: Silicon Nitride (Si3N4)
aero_elements.description: Silicon Nitride is a high-performance ceramic material offering excellent thermal shock resistance and mechanical strength. It's used in aero components that operate under extreme thermal and mechanical stresses.

suspension.name: Spring Steel (1074)
suspension.description: Spring Steel (1074) is a high-carbon steel known for its excellent spring properties. It's used in suspension systems to provide reliable and consistent performance during races.

suspension.name: Titanium Alloy (Ti-6Al-4V)
suspension.description: Titanium Alloy (Ti-6Al-4V) is employed in suspension components for its high strength and low weight. It enhances the suspension's responsiveness and durability.

suspension.name: Carbon Fiber Suspension
suspension.description: Carbon Fiber Suspension systems offer superior strength and minimal weight, allowing for precise handling and improved overall vehicle dynamics.

suspension.name: Magnesium Suspension (AZ31B)
suspension.description: Magnesium Suspension (AZ31B) provides a lightweight solution for suspension components, contributing to reduced unsprung mass and enhanced handling characteristics.

suspension.name: Maraging Steel (18Ni-300)
suspension.description: Maraging Steel (18Ni-300) is a high-strength superalloy used in suspension systems to provide exceptional durability and performance under extreme racing conditions.

suspension.name: Ceramic Reinforced Suspension
suspension.description: Ceramic Reinforced Suspension utilizes silicon carbide fibers to enhance durability and reduce weight, providing superior performance and handling characteristics.

suspension.name: Titanium Diboride Suspension
suspension.description: Titanium Diboride Suspension systems offer unmatched hardness and thermal stability, ensuring optimal performance and longevity in high-stress racing environments.

suspension.name: Nickel-Based Superalloy Suspension (Inconel 625)
suspension.description: Nickel-Based Superalloy Suspension (Inconel 625) provides exceptional strength and corrosion resistance, making it ideal for suspension components that endure extreme conditions.

suspension.name: Boron Steel Suspension
suspension.description: Boron Steel Suspension incorporates boron to improve hardenability and strength. It is used in suspension systems for enhanced toughness and resistance to wear.

suspension.name: Precipitation-Hardening Stainless Steel Suspension (17-4 PH)
suspension.description: Precipitation-Hardening Stainless Steel Suspension (17-4 PH) offers high strength and hardness through precipitation hardening. It is used in suspension components requiring excellent mechanical properties and corrosion resistance.

engine.name: Cast Iron
engine.description: Cast Iron is traditionally used in engine blocks for its excellent wear resistance and thermal stability. While heavy, it provides a solid foundation for engine components.

engine.name: Aluminum-Silicon Alloy (A356)
engine.description: Aluminum-Silicon Alloy (A356) is favored in engine construction for its lightweight properties and good castability. It enhances engine performance by reducing overall weight.

engine.name: Nickel-Based Superalloy (Inconel 718)
engine.description: Inconel 718 is a nickel-based superalloy known for its exceptional strength and resistance to high temperatures. It's ideal for critical engine components that operate under extreme conditions.

engine.name: Titanium Engine Block (Ti-6Al-4V)
engine.description: Titanium Engine Block (Ti-6Al-4V) offers a lightweight alternative to traditional engine materials. It provides high strength and corrosion resistance, improving overall engine efficiency.

engine.name: Ceramic Composite
engine.description: Ceramic Composite materials are used in engine components for their high thermal resistance and low weight. They enhance engine performance by improving heat dissipation and reducing weight.

engine.name: Inconel 625
engine.description: Inconel 625 is a nickel-based superalloy with outstanding strength and corrosion resistance. It's utilized in high-stress engine parts to ensure longevity and peak performance.

engine.name: Beryllium Copper Alloy (C17200)
engine.description: Beryllium Copper Alloy (C17200) combines high strength and conductivity, making it ideal for engine components that require both mechanical and electrical performance.

engine.name: Ultra-High Temperature Ceramic (UHTC)
engine.description: Ultra-High Temperature Ceramics (UHTC) are used in engine components exposed to extreme temperatures. They offer unparalleled thermal resistance and maintain structural integrity under high stress.

engine.name: Titanium Aluminum Vanadium (Ti-Al-V) Alloy
engine.description: Titanium Aluminum Vanadium Alloy offers a balance of strength, lightweight, and corrosion resistance. It's ideal for high-performance engine components that demand superior mechanical properties.

engine.name: Carbon Fiber Engine Mounts
engine.description: Carbon Fiber Engine Mounts provide lightweight and strong support for the engine, reducing vibrations and enhancing overall engine performance.

engine.name: Titanium Carbide (TiC)
engine.description: Titanium Carbide (TiC) is used in engine components for its exceptional hardness and thermal stability. It ensures reliable performance and longevity under extreme conditions.

engine.name: Nickel Aluminum Bronze
engine.description: Nickel Aluminum Bronze offers excellent strength, corrosion resistance, and wear resistance. It's used in engine components that require durable and reliable performance.

engine.name: Stainless Steel (304)
engine.description: Stainless Steel (304) is used in engine components for its excellent corrosion resistance and good mechanical properties. It ensures longevity and reliable performance in various racing conditions.

engine.name: Copper-Tin Alloy (Bronze)
engine.description: Copper-Tin Alloy (Bronze) is used in engine components for its good strength and corrosion resistance. It provides reliable performance and durability under high-stress conditions.

engine.name: Zirconium Alloy (Zircaloy-4)
engine.description: Zirconium Alloy (Zircaloy-4) offers excellent corrosion resistance and strength, making it ideal for engine components that operate under extreme conditions.

gearbox.name: Steel Alloy (8620)
gearbox.description: Steel Alloy (8620) is commonly used in gearboxes for its good toughness and wear resistance. It ensures reliable performance and longevity under high stress.

gearbox.name: Titanium Alloy (Ti-6Al-4V)
gearbox.description: Titanium Alloy (Ti-6Al-4V) is used in high-performance gearboxes to reduce weight while maintaining exceptional strength and durability, enhancing overall gearbox performance.

gearbox.name: Carbon Fiber Gearbox
gearbox.description: Carbon Fiber Gearbox components offer significant weight savings and high strength, improving gearbox responsiveness and reducing rotational inertia.

gearbox.name: Magnesium Alloy Gearbox (AZ31B)
gearbox.description: Magnesium Alloy Gearbox (AZ31B) provides a lightweight option for gearbox construction, contributing to reduced overall vehicle weight and improved efficiency.

gearbox.name: Inconel 718 Gearbox
gearbox.description: Inconel 718 Gearbox components deliver unparalleled strength and resistance to high temperatures. They ensure optimal gearbox performance and durability in extreme racing conditions.

gearbox.name: Ceramic Gearbox Components
gearbox.description: Ceramic Gearbox Components offer exceptional wear resistance and thermal stability, enhancing the longevity and performance of gearbox systems under extreme conditions.

gearbox.name: Titanium Diboride Gearbox
gearbox.description: Titanium Diboride Gearbox components provide unmatched hardness and thermal resistance, ensuring superior gearbox performance and durability in high-stress racing environments.

gearbox.name: Nickel Aluminum Bronze Gearbox
gearbox.description: Nickel Aluminum Bronze Gearbox offers excellent strength, corrosion resistance, and wear resistance. It's used in gearboxes that require durable and reliable performance.

gearbox.name: Silicon Nitride (Si3N4) Gearbox
gearbox.description: Silicon Nitride Gearbox components offer high thermal shock resistance and mechanical strength, ensuring reliable performance under extreme thermal and mechanical stresses.

gearbox.name: Boron Nitride Reinforced Gearbox
gearbox.description: Boron Nitride Reinforced Gearbox components enhance thermal stability and mechanical strength, providing superior durability and performance in high-stress conditions.

gearbox.name: Zirconium Alloy Gearbox (Zircaloy-4)
gearbox.description: Zirconium Alloy Gearbox (Zircaloy-4) offers excellent corrosion resistance and strength, making it ideal for gearbox components that operate under extreme conditions.

gearbox.name: Nickel Titanium Alloy Gearbox
gearbox.description: Nickel Titanium Alloy Gearbox components provide shape memory and superelasticity, allowing for adaptive performance and enhanced durability in dynamic racing environments.

brakes.name: Cast Iron
brakes.description: Cast Iron is traditionally used in brake discs for its excellent wear resistance and heat dissipation properties. While heavy, it provides reliable braking performance.

brakes.name: Carbon Ceramic
brakes.description: Carbon Ceramic brakes are lightweight and offer superior heat resistance and braking performance. They reduce unsprung mass and maintain performance under extreme conditions, though at a high cost.

brakes.name: Titanium Brakes (Ti-6Al-4V)
brakes.description: Titanium Brakes (Ti-6Al-4V) offer a lightweight alternative with high strength and excellent heat resistance. They enhance braking performance while reducing overall brake system weight.

brakes.name: Ceramic Composite Brakes
brakes.description: Ceramic Composite Brakes combine ceramic materials with composite matrices, providing outstanding heat resistance and braking efficiency. They are ideal for high-performance racing applications.

brakes.name: Maraging Steel Brakes (18Ni-300)
brakes.description: Maraging Steel Brakes (18Ni-300) offer exceptional strength and toughness, ensuring reliable braking performance and longevity even under extreme racing conditions.

brakes.name: Ceramic Matrix Composite Brakes
brakes.description: Ceramic Matrix Composite Brakes utilize silicon carbide and alumina fibers to provide superior thermal resistance and braking efficiency, ideal for high-stress racing environments.

brakes.name: Graphene Enhanced Brakes
brakes.description: Graphene Enhanced Brakes incorporate graphene layers to improve heat dissipation and structural integrity, ensuring consistent braking performance under extreme conditions.

brakes.name: Titanium Diboride Brakes
brakes.description: Titanium Diboride Brakes offer unmatched hardness and thermal stability, ensuring optimal braking performance and longevity in high-stress racing environments.

brakes.name: Hexagonal Boron Nitride Brakes
brakes.description: Hexagonal Boron Nitride Brakes utilize boron nitride's thermal properties to enhance brake performance and durability, providing reliable braking under extreme conditions.

brakes.name: Silicon Nitride Brakes (Si3N4)
brakes.description: Silicon Nitride Brakes offer high thermal shock resistance and mechanical strength, ensuring reliable braking performance even under extreme thermal and mechanical stresses.

wheels.name: Aluminum Alloy (7075-T6)
wheels.description: Aluminum Alloy (7075-T6) wheels are lightweight yet strong, providing a good balance between performance and durability. They help reduce unsprung mass, enhancing handling and responsiveness.

wheels.name: Magnesium Alloy (AZ91D)
wheels.description: Magnesium Alloy (AZ91D) wheels offer significant weight savings, improving acceleration and handling. They are slightly less durable but provide excellent performance benefits.

wheels.name: Carbon Fiber Wheels
wheels.description: Carbon Fiber Wheels are extremely lightweight and strong, reducing rotational inertia and enhancing handling. They offer superior performance but come at a higher cost.

wheels.name: Titanium Alloy Wheels (Ti-6Al-4V)
wheels.description: Titanium Alloy Wheels (Ti-6Al-4V) provide a robust yet lightweight option, enhancing wheel strength and performance. They contribute to improved handling and reduced unsprung mass.

wheels.name: Inconel 718 Wheels
wheels.description: Inconel 718 Wheels are built to withstand extreme conditions, offering maximum durability and performance. They are ideal for high-stress racing environments, providing unmatched reliability.

wheels.name: Ceramic Reinforced Wheels
wheels.description: Ceramic Reinforced Wheels incorporate silicon carbide fibers to enhance durability and reduce weight, providing superior performance and longevity.

wheels.name: Graphene Enhanced Wheels
wheels.description: Graphene Enhanced Wheels utilize graphene layers to improve strength and reduce weight, ensuring optimal handling and performance under extreme racing conditions.

wheels.name: Boron Nitride Reinforced Wheels
wheels.description: Boron Nitride Reinforced Wheels enhance thermal stability and mechanical strength, providing superior durability and performance in high-stress conditions.

wheels.name: Silicon Nitride Wheels (Si3N4)
wheels.description: Silicon Nitride Wheels offer high thermal shock resistance and mechanical strength, ensuring reliable performance even under extreme thermal and mechanical stresses.

wheels.name: Zirconium Alloy Wheels (Zircaloy-4)
wheels.description: Zirconium Alloy Wheels (Zircaloy-4) offer excellent corrosion resistance and strength, making them ideal for wheels that operate under extreme conditions.

wheels.name: Nickel Titanium Alloy Wheels
wheels.description: Nickel Titanium Alloy Wheels provide shape memory and superelasticity, allowing for adaptive performance and enhanced durability in dynamic racing environments.

wheels.name: Boron Nitride Reinforced Carbon Fiber Wheels
wheels.description: Boron Nitride Reinforced Carbon Fiber Wheels combine carbon fiber with boron nitride for enhanced thermal and mechanical properties, ensuring superior performance and durability.

electrical_system.name: Copper Wiring
electrical_system.description: Copper Wiring is essential for electrical systems due to its excellent conductivity. It ensures efficient power distribution but is relatively heavy and can be costly in large quantities.

electrical_system.name: Silver-Plated Connectors
electrical_system.description: Silver-Plated Connectors provide superior electrical conductivity and corrosion resistance. They enhance the reliability and performance of the electrical system but are more expensive than standard connectors.

electrical_system.name: Graphene Circuits
electrical_system.description: Graphene Circuits utilize graphene's exceptional electrical properties to offer ultra-fast and efficient circuitry. They significantly enhance the performance and reliability of the car's electrical systems.

electrical_system.name: Copper-Nickel Alloy Wiring (CuNi 70/30)
electrical_system.description: Copper-Nickel Alloy Wiring (CuNi 70/30) offers improved corrosion resistance and strength compared to pure copper. It ensures reliable electrical connections in demanding racing conditions.

electrical_system.name: Carbon Fiber Shielded Cables
electrical_system.description: Carbon Fiber Shielded Cables provide excellent electrical shielding and durability while maintaining a lightweight profile. They reduce electromagnetic interference and enhance overall electrical system performance.

electrical_system.name: Titanium Wire
electrical_system.description: Titanium Wire offers high strength and corrosion resistance, making it ideal for critical electrical connections that require both durability and performance.

electrical_system.name: Gold-Plated Connectors
electrical_system.description: Gold-Plated Connectors provide unmatched electrical conductivity and corrosion resistance. They ensure the highest reliability and performance for sensitive electrical systems, though at a premium cost.

electrical_system.name: Graphene Shielded Cables
electrical_system.description: Graphene Shielded Cables utilize graphene layers to provide superior electrical shielding and reduce weight, enhancing the overall performance and reliability of the electrical system.

electrical_system.name: Nickel-Titanium Shape Memory Wires
electrical_system.description: Nickel-Titanium Shape Memory Wires offer shape memory and superelasticity, allowing for adaptive electrical connections that maintain performance under dynamic conditions.

electrical_system.name: Boron Nitride Coated Cables
electrical_system.description: Boron Nitride Coated Cables provide enhanced thermal and electrical insulation, ensuring reliable performance and protection in high-performance electrical systems.

electrical_system.name: Silicon Carbide Insulated Cables
electrical_system.description: Silicon Carbide Insulated Cables offer superior thermal resistance and electrical insulation, ensuring optimal performance and safety in high-stress electrical environments.

electrical_system.name: Graphene-Titanium Hybrid Cables
electrical_system.description: Graphene-Titanium Hybrid Cables combine the conductivity of graphene with the strength of titanium, providing unparalleled performance and durability in electrical systems.
